snippet: The soldiers’ armored vehicle struck an explosive device in the deadliest attack on British forces in six years.
abstract: British forces suffer their deadliest attack in six years when an armored vehicle strikes an explosive device in southern Afghanistan, killing six soldiers; the bombing brings the death toll for British forces in Afghanistan to 404 since the war started more than a decade ago.

byline.original: By TAIMOOR SHAH and ALISSA J. RUBIN
byline.contributor: Taimoor Shah reported from Kandahar, and Alissa J. Rubin from Kabul, Afghanistan. Graham Bowley contributed reporting from Kabul, and John F. Burns from London.

lead_paragraph: The soldiers’ armored vehicle struck an explosive device in the deadliest attack on British forces in six years.

headline.seo: Explosion Kills Six British Soldiers in Afghanistan
headline.main: 6 British Soldiers Are Killed in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: 6 British Soldiers Are Killed in Afghanistan
